topics: Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Organization Breakdown Structure (OBS), and Cost Breakdown Structure (CBS)
Crew Selection, Function, Productivity and Economics

grading.policies: Attendance below 70% results in a failing grade, regardless of earned percentage. Make-up work will be accepted with pre-approval of the instructor.

policies.attendance: Attendance below 70% results in a failing grade, regardless of earned percentage.
policies.late_work: Make-up work will be accepted with pre-approval of the instructor.
policies.academic_integrity: Students must sign the Honor System pledge on all submitted work.
policies.accommodations: Stevens Institute of Technology provides accommodations for students with documented disabilities.

additional_info.course_format: Seminar-format course with class discussions, in-class assignments, and guest lecturers.
additional_info.technology_requirements: Students are expected to bring laptops, notebooks, and pens to every lecture.
additional_info.support_resources: Office of Counseling and Psychological Services (CAPS) offers mental health support.

instructor.name: Karim S. Karam
instructor.office_hours: Before synchronous sessions or schedule via email

_metadata.course_description: This course provides a comprehensive overview of construction engineering methods, techniques and equipment.
learning_outcomes: Perform preliminary cost estimates, quantity take offs, and bid cost estimates.
Understand and plan basic construction activities, and identify the resources required to perform them.
Manage the construction process through monitoring productivity and economics.
